ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acoustic neuroma (right side)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Unilateral progressive SNHL, extremely poor speech recognition (6%), absent reflexes, abnormal ABR, significant tone decay, and present TEOAEs indicate a retrocochlear lesion.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To establish hearing thresholds and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition abilities; critical for identifying retrocochlear pathology.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc; absence can indicate retrocochlear pathology.
To screen for auditory fatigue characteristic of neural lesions.
To assess outer hair cell function; presence with SNHL suggests neural etiology.
To evaluate neural synchrony and latency; highly sensitive to retrocochlear lesions.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a moderate right sensorineural hearing loss and normal left hearing. Findings are strongly indicative of a right retrocochlear lesion (e.g., acoustic neuroma), evidenced by critically poor speech recognition (6%), absent acoustic reflexes, significant tone decay, abnormal ABR latencies, and preserved TEOAEs.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate sensorineural hearing loss (flat/sloping). Left ear: Normal thresholds (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 50 dB HL, SRS 6% (extremely poor). Left ear: SRT 5 dB HL, SRS 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally (Static compliance: RE 0.80 cc, LE 0.83 cc).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral. Left ear: Present (Ipsi 85 dB HL, Contra 80 dB HL).

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear: All waves prolonged after Wave I, increased Wave I-III latency. Left ear: Normal.

tests.name: TEOAE (Transient Evoked Otoacoustic Emissions)
tests.result_summary: Present bilaterally, indicating intact outer hair cell function despite hearing loss in the right ear.

tests.name: Tone-decay test
tests.result_summary: Right ear: 30+ dB of decay in 60 seconds. Left ear: 5 dB of decay in 60 seconds.

proposed_items: Request results of diagnostic tests (ENG, radiologic studies) from the specialist
counseling_actions: Discuss impressions of a possible neural lesion (VIIIth nerve) with the patient
Advise that history and auditory findings are consistent with a possible retrocochlear lesion
Ensure the patient understands the importance of following through with the referral promptly

red_flags_present: Retrocochlear signs (absent reflexes, tone decay, abnormal ABR)

escalation.rationale_short: To confirm or deny the presence of a space-occupying lesion (acoustic neuroma) via MRI or other studies.

follow_up_plan.objective: Ensure referral is completed and obtain medical diagnosis and treatment plan.
